head.title: Treasury Sets Its Auctions of Bills for Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Sets Its Auctions of Bills for Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.69 percent and a six-month bill was 5.96 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.69 percent and a six-month bill was 5.96 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Centex Corp., $200 million to $300 million intermediate bonds, Baa2/BBB/---. Chase Bank Hambrecht & Quist.
Comdisco, $300 million of notes due 2003, Baa1/ BBB+/---. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Washington Mutual Finance (formerly Aristar) $450 million of notes due 2005, A3/A-/---. CS First Boston.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's Corp./Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX EXEMPT
TUESDAY
Glendale, Ariz., $53 million of water and sewer revenue bonds. Competitive.
Pennsylvania Higher Education Facility, $51.9 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Regional Transit Authority, Ill., $260 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY
Austin, Tex., $100 million of debt securities. Competitive.
New Mexico, $59.7 million of debt securities. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Arkansas Development Finance Authority, $70 million of debt securities. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Colorado Housing Finance Authority, $54.1 million of debt securities. George K. Baum & Co.
Community Development Administration, Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development, $138.2 million of debt securities. Legg Mason Wood Walker.
Kentucky Properties, $57 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Los Angeles County School Pooled Financing Program, $147.3 million of tax and revenue anticipation notes. Sutro & Co.
Maine, $66.3 million of general obligation bonds. PaineWebber.
Minnesota Housing Finance Authority, $71.7 million of debt securities. PaineWebber.
Missouri Housing Development Commission, $70 million of single-family mortgage revenue bonds for home-ownership loan program. A. G. Edwards & Sons.
Ohio Building Authority, $100 million of state facilities bonds. Morgan Stanley Dean Witter.
Oregon Housing, $50 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
Phoenix Industrial Development Authority, $63 million of debt securities. George K. Baum & Co.
Portland, Ore., $50 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
Rochester Community School District, Mich., $83.6 million of school building and site refunding bonds. First Union Securities.
West Virginia Cam Care, $115 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
